title: Anyone here who left BITS circuit / dual-degree or LNMIIT CSE for PES RR CSE ?
content: Wondering if anyone took up PES RR CSE knowing well that they could get the BITS Hyd campus EEE/ENI or dual-degrees Eco/Math/Phy, or LNMIIT CSE ? What were your reasons ?

I donâ€™t really have any particular interest in any branch, my decision would be purely based on placements and enjoyment for 4 years

Placements - go with CSE.
Enjoyment - well, the crowd we were with was chill. Hopefully that continues. Apart from that the curriculum is hectic.
You graduated from the EC campus?

Cool, Iâ€™ll probably stick with pes.when I counted the cutoffs compared to previous years Itâ€™s actually kind of unlikely that I can make the cutoff for bits. Just want to be prepared to make a decision if I get it

COMED-K, PESSAT, KCET juntaa all are ga-ga over RV, BMS, PES... especially PES-RR CSE. And there are youtubers will million followers who say "CS is CS". So confused (and a bit scared). Had BITS score been good enough to confidently say I'd get ECE, probably would not have asked :-)

Bhai esa kuch nahi he , Unless u wanna go cs ms right after btech or ur passionate about doing cs only ( most of the course isn't relavent for IT jobs ull be self studying anyway) , it is utter foolishness to compromise on tier 1 University for just the cse tag , esp if it's pes and bits circuital ur comparing , bits is saal ka avg 30lpa he lmao if u get circuital just go for it , the exposure and peer quality over ther is also much better than this place , however this place isn't so bad too (I'm a fresher) , u just need to find the rite ppl and ther r lots of exciting activities on campus , but i would take bits EEE over this place any day if I had the chance for a multitude of reasons
Also talk to actual bits alums/seniors and pes cs seniors and basically someone in real life before making these decisions, ytubers nd reddit is NOT where u should be making life decisions

I did :)  
It's because a dual at bits would be *risky*  
They had a semester online, with full cheating as expected, so GPA that sem would be unpredictable, and if things didn't work out, I'd be pursuing a degree I don't want/need for 5 years.
